title: Creating a System of Equations From Relevant Variables
text: Using a to represent the number of bags of chocolate pieces and $$b$$ to represent the number of bags of peanut butter pieces, we know that $$a+b=25$$ since the total is $$25$$ bags. Additionally, since we know the $$25$$ bags cost $$\$4.23$$ per bag, the total cost is $$25\times4.23=105.75$$. Knowing this total cost, we can get our second equation: $$4.89a+3.79b=105.75$$.
